etymology.description: Depicts two bamboo stalks with leaves -> earlier forms resembled 个 + 个 -> current form resembles ケ + ケ or 亇 + 亇
etymology.interpretation: The character 𥫗 visually represents two bamboo stalks with leaves, capturing the botanical appearance of bamboo. Earlier iterations of the character resembled 个 + 个, indicating the dual stalks, while the current form stylizes this into ケ + ケ or 亇 + 亇, emphasizing the leaf and stalk structure.

examples.chinese: 青翠的𥫗点缀在山坡上(青翠的𥫗點綴在山坡上)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngcuì de zhú diǎn zhuì zài shānpō shàng.
examples.english: The verdant bamboo decorates the hillside.

examples.chinese: 小河边的古亭旁有一丛𥫗(小河邊的古亭旁有一叢𥫗)，风中它轻轻摇曳(風中它輕輕搖曳)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo hé biān de gǔ tíng páng yǒu yī cóng zhú, fēng zhōng tā qīngqīng yáoyè.
examples.english: By the small river next to the ancient pavilion, a clump of bamboo gently sways in the wind.
